original_title: US’ RM Parks signs deal for fuel retailing in Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has signed a 20 year agreement with the US based RM parks to be a fuel distributor in the country, Minister of Power Kanchana Wijesekera said.

“US based Petroleum company RM Parks in a collaboration with Shell PLC signed the agreement to enter the Sri Lanka petroleum business today. RM Parks will be the 4th supplier to enter the domestic market & will operate under the Shell branding,” Wijesekera in a twitter message said.
“They signed a 20 year agreement to import, distribute & sell petroleum products through 150 fuel stations allocated from CPC.”
The firm will also be given the permission to establish 50 new fuel stations in the country.
“They will upgrade the fuel stations with new automated dispensers, electric charge stations, mini markets & cafes” Wijesekera said.

The cabinet gave the approval for three oil companies from China, the United States, and Australia in collaboration with Shell Pl in March,2023 to lease 150 fuel station for each company to operate in local market.
The government signed an agreement with China’s Sinopec group on May 22, and expects to begin its operations within 45 days of being given as license, the statement said. (Colombo/ June 08/2023)
